alert.note: Alert for Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 11:41AM CST until March 13 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Arkansas... Mississippi River at Caruthersville affecting Lauderdale, Dyer, Pemiscot, Lake and Mississippi Counties. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Caruthersville. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, In Missouri, docks of the steel mill near Hickman are flooding. In Tennessee, Mississippi River overbank flooding is occurring across Highway 88 just north of Dee Webb Road. Extensive amounts of Chickasaw National Wildlife Refuge are flooded. Sloughs at the west end of Barr Road are beginning to back up into fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 29.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 32.5 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.6 feet on 07/29/1958. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
